Description: Closed rail links for grain transport = more road trains = more risk = more insurance, roadworks and medical costs - all pushed up because we're too stupid to reduce road trains/traffic and invest in cheaper, should be the Fed's & State's responsibility.  This applies across the country where rail links have been closed "due to costs" and the real cost of more roads, pollution, vehicles, risks being disguised - fragmented, dispersed and difficult to measure.  Another short sighted loser policy!
